comments:
I have a Java Eclipse project.

I do a refactoring in renaming the java package file:

change com.transparentready.rde.sample to com.transparentready.rde.toto.

I checked the 3 options in the panel:
  - update reference
  - update textual matches

Next I select Preview button, Next button and finally Ok button.

I get an exception. 
The message say 

"Reason:
  File doesn't exist
"

In the log I get the message:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ltk.ui.refactoring 4 10000 Oct 27, 2004 17:58:19.159
!MESSAGE Internal Error
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: The file does not exist.
	at 
org.eclipse.ltk.internal.ui.refactoring.UIPerformChangeOperation.executeChange
(UIPerformChangeOperation.java:80)
	at org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.PerformChangeOperation.run
(PerformChangeOperation.java:196)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run
(Workspace.java:1673)
	at org.eclipse.ltk.internal.ui.refactoring.WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.run
(WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:101)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.filebuffers 4 0 Oct 27, 2004 17:58:19.159
!MESSAGE The file does not exist.

Is there anything else in the log which tells which file doesn't exist.

It seems that the workspace isn't in sync with the underlying file system. So
the problem should go away after doing a refresh of the workspace. If this isn't
the case do you have steps to reproduce ?
Closing, no response from reporter providing the necessary information.
